intro: Stackhousia doryopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrub form and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the autumn season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
